text: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has been criticised by some Nationals members after he announced plans to extend the Farm Household Allowance at the same time that Michael McCormack also announced the funding. Several Nationals expressed frustration about the timing of the prime minister's announcement on Thursday in off-the-record interviews. But some from the party publicly defended Morrison, with MP Keith Pitt telling Sky News he is not concerned about the news’ delivery so long as the money comes. The extended allowance gives drought-affected farmers a one-time payment once the four-year period comes to an end. Single people would receive $7,500 while couples would get $13,000. Image: Getty
